description.en: During the course, students can participate in article writing process from writing  title, abstract and introduction to the skill of answering to the reviewer. Seminars and active disucssions are aimed at giving tricks and advice in order to cope better with writing skills.
description.et: Kursuse käigus on tudengil võimalus osaleda akadeemilise kirjutamise protsessis alates pealkirja panemisest, abstrakti ja sissejuhatuse kirjutamisest kuni retsensendile vastamise oskusega. Seminaride ja aktiivsele osalusele suunatud arutelude kaudu saavad tudengid nippe ja soovitusi, kuidas artikli kirjutamisega paremini hakkama saada.

objectives.en: The aim of the course is to introduce the process of writing and publishing a research paper in social sciences. During the course, process of article writing is going to be taken apart and through the seminars, support is provided for the doctoral students in the phase of article-writing.
objectives.et: Teadusartikli publitseerimine sotsiaalteadustes aine eesmärgiks on tutvustada teadusartikli kirjutamise/avaldamise protsessi sotsiaalteadustes. Kursuse raames võetakse artikli kirjutamise protsess elementideks ning pakutakse seminaride näol tuge artikli-kirjutamise faasis olevatele doktorantidele.

learning_outcomes.et:
Tudeng mõistab nõudmisi oma valdkonna teaduspublikatsioonidele.
Tudeng mõistab ja analüüsib artikli kirjutamise erinevaid elemente.
Tudeng teab retsenseerimise protsessist ja suudab selles osaleda.

independent_work.et:
03.10 Small written reflection:  What do I understand as theory? What does "theory" mean to me? What kind of theory do I plan to you in my thesis? 
 24.10 Small written reflection: What is the aim of my article/thesis? What are the burning questions that I aim to provide answers to? How does my research contribute to the wider field? Why should someone care to read my research? 
 07.11 Small written reflection: what kind of writer am I? Do I like to write alone or with a co-author? Why? When is my "tiger time" for writing? Am I the "final version" type of a writer, or rather messy brain-storming type of a writer? 
 05.12 Testing title-writing skills: provide 3 different titles for each of the categories:  1) for your upcoming peer reviewed journal article; 2) for your upcoming academic conference presentation; 3) for your upcoming popular journal article 
09.01 Abstract writing: write a 250-Word abstract for 1) a conference in your respective field; and 2) for your upcoming peer reviewed journal article

grade_preconditions.et: All written-home assignments need to be finished and uploaded in Moodel for each class. If missing a class, all assignments need to be uploaded by 15. January, the latest. Class attendance: 75% of the meetings

grade_evaluation.et: All written home-assignments need to be uploaded in Moodel. They will be discussed upon in class. Class attendance: at least 75% of the meetings. When missing a class, home-assignments need to be still completed in order to get the credit points.

debt_elimination.et: Missed seminar assignments cannot be completed at home, but all home assignments need to be handed in by 15. January, the latest, in order to get the credit points.
